intro: Angostura heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf angostura, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to lanceolate, depending on environmental conditions. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
